lore: Although Imlings treat Imlers with condescension and sometimes take advantage of their naivete, they do not let any others tease them and feel a great attachment to them.\n\nVarve Imlings are very aware of the tenacity with which Imlers protect them and that they could not survive without them, so they always focus their efforts on healing their big partners when they are attacked.
menagerieDialog: (It seems to have scribbled something on the floor. Upon closer insepction, you realize it says, 'I'm sleepy, let me rest.')
(It draws something on a scroll and hands it to you. It's a picture of a creature being slammed to death by an Imler. That's most definitely the first sign of a serial killer in the making.)
(This particular creature is extremely introverted, which is a rarity for Imlings.)
(It's busy drawing a picture on a scroll. Upon further inspection, you realize it's a lewd picture of Hebron's mother.)
(The Imling is holding up its middle finger and waving it in front of your other creatures. Grow up, Imling.)
name: Varve Imling
